pr_title: Low-hanging Fruit: UI improvements, off-hand build wand, crafter recipe adds, and expanding raid command capabilities.

timeline.message:
- Adds expanded message on completion of deconstruction to warn to use the hut GUI to pick up the block if intending to retain level, from https://github.com/ldtteam/minecolonies-features/issues/215

- Adds a progress message at 25 citizens, pointing players to the University research.

- Adds disabled/enabled button functionality and tooltips for Warehouse Upgrade, from https://github.com/ldtteam/minecolonies-features/issues/222 .  Also similar for Sort.

- Adds a time check to WAREHOUSE_FULL messages, to reduce message spamming, and gives different messages depending on whether the warehouse can still be upgraded (in which case it can't use emerald blocks) or not.

- Adds glowstone dust as an output to the mechanic, for https://github.com/ldtteam/minecolonies-features/issues/176 , and sets glowstone (block) as non-reducible to avoid potential surprises to datapack makers. Added a few other exclusions for storage-like blocks that Forge does not inherently tag, for similar reasons.

- Adds Blackstone and Polished Blackstone (and polished blackstone slab/bricks) as usable ingredients to the Stonemason, and Polished Basalt to the Stonesmelter's outputs, for #6231.

- Allows use of build tool in off-hand, from #6232.

- Initial work to recognize Pillager Patrol spawn events.

- Removes concrete layer from Jungle Archery 1.

- Removes duplicate sendPlayersMessage for WorkOrderBuildRemovals.

- Removes Illager Patrol event handler precursor work.

- Add a third count to the Town Hall's citizen summary page, indicating the maximum limit of colonists from research, from https://github.com/ldtteam/minecolonies-features/issues/200

- Adds an optional argument to raid-now, raid-now-all, raid-tonight, and raid-tonight-all to force the raid to be a specific type, from https://github.com/ldtteam/minecolonies-features/issues/212 .

- Adds a raid event for pirates without a ship, only runable by manual raid commands for now.

Changes WindowTownHall to show current count of citizens a little smarter.  Updates a few javadocs related to citizen max counts.

Changes Warehouse tile entity to use world.getGameTime instead of system time.

Switches the Town Hall's information page Citizen Count from using Minecraft § codes to instead split the label in two pieces and using a little smarter.  Also adds (short) tooltips for most limiting states.

timeline.bodyText: So, emerald block makes sense at level 5, but a warehouse full at level 4 this message is confusing.
timeline.author: Mekle001

replies.bodyText:
It should only give the "The Warehouse is full, please use an emerald block to make more space in the racks!" message at level five.  At level four, it will give "The Warehouse is full, please upgrade it!".  Did I goof that up, or does the level four or lower message need different wording?
I guess it might make sense to add a third message for when the warehouse is T5 and has all of its emerald upgrades, if that's the concern.

timeline.message:
Adds a very simple registry of raid types.  It might eventually be worth expanding to manage raid entities and sounds, but for now, it's just names.

Unifies raid-now and raid-tonight, and raid-All-now and raid-All-tonight.  These also use the RaidTypeRegistry to populate suggestions, and to apply their results in RaidManager.
Scraps RaidTypeRegistry and implementation, moves "raid" and "raid-All" commands to use ColonyEventTypeRegistry instead.  Cleans up some logic flow.
